item.title: Naive Bayes Classifier in JavaScript
item.description: The Naive Bayes classifier is a pretty popular text classification algorithm because of it’s simplicity. You’ll often see this classifier used for spam detection, authorship attribution, gender authentication, determing whether a review is positive or negative, and even sentiment analysis. The Naive Bayes classifier takes in a corpus (body of text) known as a document, which then a stemmer runs through the document and returns a “bag or words” so to speak.
